src:
Kvinne trolig kvalt av pytonslange
36 år gammel kvinne funnet med en pytonslange rundt halsen.
01 Nov 2019, 04:30 by Lars Martin Gimse
36 år gamle Laura Hurst ble onsdag funnet død med en pytonslange kveilet rundt halsen, skriver CNN.

36-åringen ble funnet livløs, og det ble igangsatt livreddende arbeid, men livet sto ikke til å redde.

- Kvalt av slangen
Politibetjent Kim Riley ved Indiana-politiet forteller til Journal & Courier at Hurst ble funnet på gulvet i huset onsdag kveld. Pytonslangen hang da ganske løst rundt halsen hennes, og personen som fant henne lyktes i å fjerne slangen fra henne.
Den eksakte dødsårsaken er foreløpig uviss, men Hurst skal obduseres fredag.

- Det ser ut til at hun har blitt kvalt av slangen. Men vi vet ikke det sikkert før etter obduksjonen, sier Riley.

Eieren av huset, den lokale politisjefen Don Munson, som selv bor i nabohuset, sier at Hursts dødsfall er en «tragisk ulykke» og at han samarbeider med politiet.
- Jeg har gitt all informasjon til det statlige politiet, sier Munson.
- Slanger var hennes lidenskap
Det fantes ikke mindre enn 140 slanger i huset der Hurst ble funnet.

- Hun skal ha hatt slanger der selv, sier Riley.

Ifølge CNN skal Hurst ha hatt rundt 20 slanger i huset.
Marcel Katz, som representerte Hurst i en pågående skilsmisse, forteller at slanger var så viktig for 36-åringen at det spilte en vesentlig rolle under skilsmisseforhandlingene.
- Slanger var hennes lidenskap. Det var veldig viktig for henne, sier Katz.
Slange som ble funnet rundt Hursts hals var en nettpyton. Den er regnes som verdens lengste slange, og kan bli åtte ni meter lang.
text:
Woman probably suffocated by python
36 year old woman found with a python snake around her neck.
01 Nov 2019, 04:30 by Lars Martin Gimse
36-year-old Laura Hurst was found dead Wednesday with a python coiled around her neck, CNN writes.

The 36-year-old was found lifeless and life-saving work was initiated, but life was not saved.

- Tormented by the snake
Indiana Police Chief Kim Riley tells the Journal & Courier that Hurst was found on the floor of the house Wednesday night. The python snake then hung loosely around her neck, and the person who found her succeeded in removing the snake from her.
The exact cause of death is currently uncertain, but Hurst will be autopsied Friday.

- It looks like she's been strangled by the snake. But we don't know for sure until after the autopsy, Riley says.

The owner of the house, local police chief Don Munson, who lives in the neighboring house himself, says Hurst's death is a "tragic accident" and that he is cooperating with police.
"I've given all the information to the state police," says Munson.
- Snakes were her passion
There were no less than 140 snakes in the house where Hurst was found.

- She must have had snakes there herself, says Riley.

According to CNN, Hurst is said to have had around 20 hoses in the house.
Marcel Katz, who represented Hurst in an ongoing divorce, says that snakes were so important to the 36-year-old that it played a significant role during the divorce negotiations.
- Snakes were her passion. It was very important to her, says Katz.
A snake found around Hurst's neck was a net python. It is considered the world's longest snake and can be eight meters long.
